Clipped from: [https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/index.htm](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/index.htm)

## 1885-1971

“Mental confusion is not always chaos. It may strengthen the internal contradictions for the time being but in the long run it will lead to their resolution. ... Only the Russian Revolution really opened a window to the future; the fall of Czarism brought a glimpse of it, and with the collapse of capitalism it appeared in full view. ... at last! at last! a way for mankind to escape from war and capitalism.” [1967 Preface](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/lukacs67.htm)

![Georg Lukacs - sketch taken from Hegel Made Easy of intellectual looking east european man in thick glasses](data:image/png;base64,)

  
 

[Biography](https://www.marxists.org/glossary/people/l/u.htm#lukacs-georg)

[eBooks for Lukacs](https://www.marxists.org/ebooks/index.htm#georglukacs)

Early Works

[The Theory of the Novel](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/theory-novel/index.htm) (1914)  
 [Tactics and Ethics](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1919/tactics-ethics.htm) (1919)  
 [The Role of Morality in Communist Production](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1919/morality.htm) (1919)  
 [The Moral Mission of the Communist Party](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1920/moral-mission.htm) (1920)  
 [Tagore’s Gandhi Novel](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1922/tagore.htm) (1922)

from [History & Class Consciousness](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/index.htm)

 [The Marxism of Rosa Luxemburg](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/ch02.htm) (Jan 1921)  
 [Class Consciousness](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/lukacs3.htm) (March 1920)  
 Reification and the Consciousness of the Proletariat (1923)

[Immediacy and Mediation](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_1.htm#s1)          2. [The point of Departure for the Proletariat](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_1.htm#s2)          3. [Immanent Critique](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_3.htm)          4. [Dialectical Totality](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_3.htm#s4)          5. [Humanism, Reification and Fetishism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_5.htm)          6. [The Class Consciousness of the Proletariat](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/hcc07_5.htm#s6) [Legality and Illegality](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/ch06.htm) (July 1920)

 [Towards a Methodology of the Problem of Organisation](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/history/ch08.htm) (Sep 1922)

 [The Struggle of Humanism and Barbarism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1943/humanism-barbarism/index.htm), 1943

 [Romanticism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/lukacs/works/1945/romanticism.htm) , 1945

Posthumous
